word_mean: 着丝粒：染色体的收缩部分，为染色单体的连接点，细胞分裂时，染色体藉以附着于纺锤体。按照其部位，着丝粒可分为中央着丝粒，近中央着丝粒和近端着丝粒
一般位于染色体的主缢痕或染色体端部，使姐妹染色单体连在一起，在其两侧各有一由蛋白质构成的动粒。

sentence.Network_en: Each chromosome consists of two chromatids held together by the centromere.
sentence.Network_cn: 每个染色体由两个染色单体所组成,它们被一个着丝点联结在一起.

sentence.Network_en: The duplicates are attached to each other at a constricted region called the centromere.
sentence.Network_cn: 对偶体彼此相连于称为着丝粒的缩小的区域.

sentence.Network_en: Following the replication of chromosomes, resultant chromatids remain attached at the centromere.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着染色体的复制, 着丝粒始终连接着形成的两个染色单体.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 着丝点（Centromere）：在细胞的有丝分裂过程中，从细胞的两端发出纺锤丝，连接在染色体的着丝点上，将染色体拉向细胞的两级 …
生化百科词汇... ... Cell Migration 细胞迁移 Centromeres 着丝粒 Centrosomes and Microtubule Nucleation 着丝粒和微管成核.

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1920s: from Latin centrum (see centre) + Greek meros 'part'

means.word_mean: 1. a specialized condensed region of each chromosome that appears during mitosis where the chromatids are held together to form an X shape;
